intro: Lippia sidoides f. flaccida, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed or flaccid lippia, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its foliage contains essential oils that contribute to its distinctive fragrance and potential pharmacological properties.
